quest.name: In the Name of the Light
journal: The manager of suites is looking a little anxious.

As you converse with the manager of suites in the Pendants, Moren arrives to thank you for revealing the truth about Ardbert and his comrades to the people. While on the subject, you take the opportunity to ask him what he knows of Warriors of Light, and he seems all too eager to enlighten you─when suitably prepared. The librarian duly heads back to the Cabinet of Curiosity to gather up materials, and bids you join him there at your earliest convenience.

Reporting for your lesson at the Cabinet, you are soon joined by Alphinaud, Alisaie, and Ryne, who chanced to be there on separate errands. His class duly assembled, Moren proceeds to explain that, despite sharing no apparent connection, many individuals have been hailed as Warriors of Light throughout Vrandtic history, and that in time the title came to be a synonym for hero. Intrigued, Alphinaud observes that the epithet is similarly used in the Source, and posits that Hydaelyn is likely the common thread. As you ponder what this might imply, you are interrupted by a little girl's excited voice followed by the rumble of tumbling tomes. You turn towards the commotion to find three Crystarium younglings, a shame-faced Riqi-Tio and her friends Arkil and Eirwel, whom Moren wastes no time chastising for their lack of care. Upon realizing she is in the presence of the great Warrior of Darkness, however, Riqi-Tio's chagrin reverts to excitement, and she can barely contain herself as she asks you what she must do to become a hero─or “Warrior of Light.”

In impassioned tones, Riqi-Tio elaborates on her ambition. She wishes to become a specific kind of Warrior of Light─one who uses potions to fight─and has come to the Cabinet to study. Rather than through tomes, however, Alphinaud believes she stands to learn best by observing the chirurgeons at work, and to that end he bids you accompany the Mystel child to Spagyrics.

The kindly Chessamile takes Riqi-Tio under her wing, and entrusts her with a task: retrieving a potion ingredient from Sweetsieve. Lest her new charge come to harm, the chief chirurgeon requests that you go along to keep a watchful eye, before directing you to seek out a woman named Gracine.

Gracine informs you that Chessamile's order is for grapes, but apologetically adds that they have yet to be harvested. At her suggestion, you go to help Alphinaud and Riqi-Tio pick bunches of undersized fruit directly from the vines.
You pick what appears to be a reasonable haul of grapes, and take them to Riqi-Tio.

Fruit-picking concluded, Alphinaud asks Riqi-Tio what inspired her decision to become an apothecary and a Warrior of Light. The girl's response prompts him to reevaluate his belief that it was Elidibus who planted the desire to become Warriors of Light within people's hearts. Instead, he concludes, the desire to help their fellow man was present from the beginning. Having reaffirmed his resolve to settle matters in the First before departing for the Source, Alphinaud bends his steps back to Spagyrics, and you follow in turn.

Riqi-Tio proudly delivers the grapes to Chessamile, and by the completion of this little task, takes her first step on the road to becoming a Warrior of Light. It falls to you to ensure that her pure intent is not twisted to serve some grand Ascian design...
objectives: Deliver the bunches of undersized grapes to Riqi-Tio.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Ah, MistressMaster Surname. Will you be venturing forth today?

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Do be sure to take care if so. Though they say the starshower was harmless, one can never be too careful.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: ...But I concede it is not for me to tell the Warrior of Darkness how to look after herselfhimself. Old habits, you understand.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: (-???-)Ah, Forename! How very opportune!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Greetings, my friend. Do you perchance have a moment to spare?

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Wonderful, wonderful!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: I wanted to thank you, you see. For revealing to us the truth of the Warriors of Light.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: After all these years, your tale set the record straight. Finally, the people see them as the great heroes they were.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Or the great hero he is in the case of Ardbert. You too were surprised to see him, I think?

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: At the time, I was not certain what to make of it all, but I could see the effect his words had on those around me. And then the stars rained down from the sky, and...well, you know the rest.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: When the commotion died down, you were nowhere to be seen, but I was determined to express my gratitude. And so here I am.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename─for giving voice to the truth, and restoring the Warriors of Light to their rightful place in history.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Should you, perhaps, wish to have your account of these matters committed to writing, I would be more than willing to serve as your scribe. Indeed, if there is anything I can do to help─anything at all─you need only say the word.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: What can you tell me about the Warriors of Light?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Very well. Tell me what the situation is like in the city.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: I beg your pardon? You wish to ask me about the Warriors of Light?

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Forgive me, but I daresay you already know more about them than any living soul─save for Ardbert himself, of course.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Unless...you refer to the Warriors of Light more broadly?

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: If so, I may yet be able to assist you in some small way.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: The situation in the city? Do you mean...the people's awakening as Warriors of Light?

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Well, while questions remain about the circumstances surrounding Ardbert's return, history tells us that what took place may not be entirely unprecedented.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Ah, but to understand that requires an understanding of “Warriors of Light” in a broader Vrandtic context.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: If it please you, I should be glad to provide an overview. I flatter myself that it may grant you a better grasp of that which is occurring not only in the Crystarium, but the world at large.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Excellent! I shall return to the Cabinet at once and look up the relevant texts. Pray join me at your earliest convenience.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: No rest for the righteous, it would seem.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Do not let me keep you, misssir. I bid you a pleasant day.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, excellent timing. I have but this moment finished gathering the materials for our lesson.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: As a great many works make reference to the Warriors of Light, I shall─with your permission─focus only upon the details that seem most relevant.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Warriors of Light, you say? Forgive us, but we couldn't help overhearing.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We've been out keeping watch over the Crystarium, but it appears to be business as usual.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So I thought I'd spend some time brushing up my knowledge of familiars, and Alphinaud volunteered to help.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I...actually came on a different errand, but I'd be interested in hearing about the Warriors of Light as well.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: May I join you?

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Of course, of course! The more the merrier!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: If you would care to find a table below, I shall be down with the books in a moment.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Were one to pore over the annals of Vrandtic history, one would note the comparatively frequent recurrence of individuals hailed as “Warriors of Light.”

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Ardbert and his comrades require no introduction, but many others bore the epithet long before them.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: To name but a few, there was Tolthewil, legendary first king of Lakeland, Roddfort and Saulard, the fabled Drahn and Galdjent duo of Voeburt...

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: And no list of Vrandtic heroes would be complete without the archmage Tiuna of Ronka. In older texts, she too was called a Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It did surprise me how ready people were to forget the negative associations of the title. But it makes sense if it's been around for centuries.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Verily. In ages past, it was simply a synonym for “hero.”

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: In the wake of the Flood, however, Light came to be regarded with fear; the title used not to exalt, but to revile.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: A far cry from its beginnings...

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: This, my friends, is Norvrandt's oldest epic. The original tale of the struggle between good and evil.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: In a time when all lay shrouded in Darkness, a prophesied hero rose to deliver the world from its doom. Fighting in the name of the Light, the hero styled himself its foot soldier. And thus did he come to be known as “The Warrior of Light.”

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Curiously, in the centuries that followed, other heroes appeared who claimed the selfsame epithet, despite sharing no discernible connection with their predecessors.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: And in time, Warrior of Light came to be a name accorded to all men and women of uncommon skill and valor.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well, well... The plot thickens.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As you know, the title of Warrior of Light is also used in the Source.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though the manners in which individuals have earned it are many and varied, heroes have been honored thus since antiquity.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Nor does the custom show any sign of dying out─as you can well attest.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It makes you wonder, doesn't it... It surely can't be a coincidence.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Indeed not.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Let us imagine a man who has awakened to the Echo and is able to hear Hydaelyn's voice. As She styles him, so too does he style himself─a Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Of course, being blessed with the Echo does not in itself make one a hero. And conversely, there will have been no few heroes who were not blessed with it.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But such distinctions are immaterial to the masses, and over time they came to use the title “Warrior of Light” and the word “hero” interchangeably.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Sounds about right. It would be interesting to see if the theory holds true in the other worlds─if crossing the rift were that easy.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Hydaelyn did call me a Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: What's in a name? It doesn't change anything.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: And there I was thinking I was special...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: She did? I've never heard Her voice myself.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: But I can feel Her presence. Perhaps through Minfilia.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Well...I think a name can mean a lot. And I imagine it would be terrible to have people call you something which didn't feel right.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: B-But you are special! No matter how many Warriors of Light there are out there, there's no one like you!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: At any rate, assuming all of this is true, and there's a common thread behind the epithet, I doubt the Ascians will have been amused.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: To have the world at large associate Light, and by extension Hydaelyn, with “good” must have added insult to injury.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Ahem. While this discussion is undeniably fascinating, I wonder...should I be privy to it? Mayhap it would be better if I excused myself...?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Oh! No need for that, my friend! Pray accept our apologies. Your lesson on the Warriors of Light has given us much to ponder...

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: (-Little Girl's Voice-)Ooh, ooh! Did someone say Warriors of Light!?

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: (-Little Girl's Voice-)Uwaaah!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Riqi-Tio! Are you all right!?

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Ahhh, my precious tomes... <sigh> Did I not say you must take care in the Cabinet?

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: You too, Arkil! Eirwel!

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: (-Arkil-)We're sorry, Master Moren...

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: (-Arkil-)<gasp> Aren't you...?

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: ...The Warrior of Darkness!?

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: M-My name's Riqi-Tio, and...and I want to help everyone!

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Please, tell me what I have to do to be a hero─to be a Warrior of Light!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Setting aside our misgivings, it would seem churlish to discourage the young lady. Let's hear what she has to say.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: No harm done. To the children, at least...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Even children want to become Warriors of Light...

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: The children's inquisitiveness is to be commended, but...ahhh, my precious tomes...

dialogue.name: EIRWEL
dialogue.text: We're sorry we knocked over the books...

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: Um...do you remember me?

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: When you returned from the sea with the Exarch, I asked you how you became so strong.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: So, I want to be a Warrior of Light. But not one that fights with a sword and all that.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: No, I want to be the kind that fights with potions and heals people! An apothecary!

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: And I'm going to help everyone in the Crystarium. No, in all of Norvrandt!

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: When I told Arkil and Eirwel this, they said that the Cabinet should have lots of tomes about potions.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: But this place is so big, and we don't have the faintest idea where to begin searching. At this rate, I'm not going to get anywhere...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If one knew where to look, one should indeed be able to find treatises on potions here. Even so, I fear they may prove a little difficult for ones so young. But hmmm...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Esteemed Warrior of Darkness, perhaps you might accompany young Riqi-Tio to Spagyrics? Rather than through tomes, I believe she stands to learn more by observing the chirurgeons at their work.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Sounds like a plan. It seems we've finished here, so we'll come with you.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Last one to Spagyrics is a rotten egg!

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: I'll go, but only for a little while.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: I don't have time for this...

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Hah, I'll have you know I'm really fast! You're going to be the rotten egg!

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Really? Thank you so much, Warrior of Darkness! We'll see you at Spagyrics!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I know you are a busy womanman, but we can't well leave them without guidance. And it would only be for a little while.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You can find your way to Spagyrics, I trust? Off you go, then, and have care you do not knock anything else over.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: I shall remain here and tidy up. I hope that today's lesson will be of some use to you.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: See how her eyes shine, my friend. We have made her day.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ascian machination or no, it wouldn't do to dash the dreams of one so young. The Exarch would feel the same, I believe.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: A warrior who fights with potions... It's certainly innovative. I prefer a blade myself, but to each her own.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It appears there aren't so many patients at the moment. I only pray that such peaceful days continue.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Right, I'm here! What do I do? What do I do?

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: Chessamile's medicines work really well. I just wish they didn't taste so bad.

dialogue.name: EIRWEL
dialogue.text: After you've finished helping Riqi, can you help us become Warriors of Light too?

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: Well now, to what do I owe the pleasure of so many bright-eyed visitors?

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: Is that the way of it, sweetie? You wish to learn about medicine?

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: That's right! I want to become a Warrior of Light who uses potions to help people all over the world!

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: Well, that is a very noble endeavor, and you aren't alone in it. No few at our infirmary yearn to venture forth as Warriors of Light.

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: But ultimately, they have all decided not to pursue that dream.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Huh? Why?

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: Because the people here need them too, sweetie.

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: The guards who place themselves in harm's way to keep us safe. The artisans who toil tirelessly that we might sustain our way of life. And younglings like you, who are the future of the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: They couldn't simply abandon them, you see. And so, difficult though it was, they made the decision to remain.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Then...does this mean my dream isn't any good?

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: Oh, sweetie, yours is a wonderful dream. And it would be my pleasure to help you to pursue it.

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: If we all work hard, the day will come when our chirurgeons may set forth to aid folk in every corner of the realm.

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: As we strive towards that day, I hope that we can rely upon you as well. Though I must warn you, ours is not an easy path. No, you must work very, very hard.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: I'm not afraid of hard work! I'll become the best apothecary ever, just you watch!

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: Hee hee, that's the spirit! Without further ado, then, may I entrust you with a task?

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: I have placed an order at Sweetsieve for a potion ingredient, and I would like you to go and collect it.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Ooh, an ingredient! Leave it to me, miss!

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: My, such an abundance of energy. Though I can't help wonder if she'll be all right by herself...

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: My apologies, but would you mind accompanying her? When you arrive at Sweetsieve, speak with a woman named Gracine, and she will point you in the right direction.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I shall join you. As the one who suggested this course to Riqi-Tio, I would assist in her first steps.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: And what about the two of you? Are you coming along too?

dialogue.name: EIRWEL
dialogue.text: Well, we do want to become Warriors of Light, just not the same kind as Riqi.

dialogue.name: EIRWEL
dialogue.text: So we'll wait for you here, Warrior of Darkness. When you return, please teach us how to fight!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: In that case, Ryne and I shall keep them company and take the opportunity to ask about their aspirations.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Too many grown-ups would only diminish Riqi-Tio's sense of accomplishment. We'll stay here and talk to her friends.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: If it's to be had at Sweetsieve, I assume the ingredient is some manner of crop.

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: We know you're busy, but we want to be just like you. We hope you'll teach us how.

dialogue.name: EIRWEL
dialogue.text: We won't move an ilm until you return!

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: Thank you, sweetie. I feel better knowing that you're keeping an eye on Riqi-Tio.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are. As it turns out, the ingredient still wants for harvesting, so we are going about that now.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Are these small enough?

dialogue.name: GRACINE
dialogue.text: <gasp> If it isn't the Warrior of Darkness herselfhimself! May I assume you are with Master Alphinaud?

dialogue.name: GRACINE
dialogue.text: Right. Lest you wonder, Chessamile's order is for grapes.

dialogue.name: GRACINE
dialogue.text: As busy as we have been of late, however, I regret to say we didn't have the time to harvest them.

dialogue.name: GRACINE
dialogue.text: So it was with apologies that I asked Master Alphinaud and his young companion to help themselves to the fruits on the vines. Perhaps you could lend them a hand?

dialogue.name: GRACINE
dialogue.text: It's the undersized grapes you'll want to pick. They're too small for normal consumption, but suitable for making wine and medicine.

dialogue.name: GRACINE
dialogue.text: My apologies again for failing to have the grapes ready. Next time, please let us treat you to the pick of the crop!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I've harvested all the undersized grapes I could find here. How goes the picking effort?

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Oh, you're here too? We're picking little grapes. It's quite fun!

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Wow, you've picked this many already!? Amazing!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I daresay we have enough between us. Shall we take them back to Chessamile?

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Heh heh! I can't wait to see what she's going to do with them!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Tell me, Riqi─what made you want to become an apothecary and Warrior of Light?

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Why? Well...

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: A while ago, I fell sick. Really sick. My body was burning up, and I felt so weak I couldn't even get out of bed.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Then a traveling apothecary came and gave me a potion to drink. It was the foulest thing I'd ever tasted...but it made me get better!

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: She was so brave─the apothecary, I mean. She went around taking care of people, even when it was dangerous. And I decided I wanted to help people, just like her.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: So I started brewing potions out of grass and giving them to my friends. But I didn't really know what I was doing, or if there was anything else I could do.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Then not long ago, a neighbor told me he was going to become a Warrior of Light, and go traveling the world, helping people.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: And I thought, that's the same as what I want to do!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I see. Out of curiosity, what did your neighbor do in the end?

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Theyler? I haven't seen him for a bit, so he must already be out there looking for people to help.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Theyler... One of the guards awakened by the starshower.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you for sharing your tale with us, Riqi-Tio. I myself took inspiration from one not unlike your traveling apothecary, and I hope her good example will spur you on to realize your dreams.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But it will not be done in a day. Such lofty goals are reached through hard work and persistence, through countless little acts of heroism─like delivering the grapes to Chessamile.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...It would seem I have been laboring under a misapprehension.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I had convinced myself that it was Elidibus who had sowed the desire to become Warriors of Light within the hearts of the people.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But I see now that the impulse to aid their fellow man abided within them from the first.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Elidibus did no more than give it a name.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And as he so kindly proclaimed, we must return to our own world ere long.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: With the Exarch laboring tirelessly, I doubt not but that a way will be found.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Yet I believe I speak for us all when I say I cannot leave in good conscience─not until we have dealt with Elidibus.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: This is no longer a strange and distant land, after all. Norvrandt has become as a home to us, and her people our own.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hm. Let us return to Spagyrics. It wouldn't do to keep your admirers waiting.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Riqi-Tio has delivered her grapes, as have I.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: After chatting with Arkil and Eirwel here, we came to an agreement─but I'll let them explain their request themselves.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Riqi-Tio was beaming with pride when she returned.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It may only have been a simple task, but she won't soon forget this achievement.

dialogue.name: RIQITIO
dialogue.text: Thanks for helping with the grapes, Warrior of Darkness. In return, I promise to brew you a potion one day!

dialogue.name: ARKIL
dialogue.text: Riqi didn't make you drink one of her grass potions, did she?

dialogue.name: EIRWEL
dialogue.text: Huzzah, you're back! We're ready to start learning!

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: My thanks for your kind help, sweetie. We now have all the ingredients we require.

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: From the grapes we shall make a vinegar, to which we will add elf grass and a few other herbs to produce an invigorating syrup. Though it's unspeakably sour, it does wonders for the constitution.

dialogue.name: CHESSAMILE
dialogue.text: As part of her studies, I may just have to give Riqi-Tio a little taste. Hee hee!
